item.description:
Maple Farm Sanctuary is an animal sanctuary providing lifelong
homes for abused, abandoned and unwanted farmed animals while
promoting veganism and respect for all life through public
information.

What: 3rd Annual Open House - Picnic, Music and Barn
Tours.
Where: Maple Farm Sanctuary, 101 North Avenue, Mendon, MA
01756
When: November 2, 2008 (Sunday) 1:00 â€“ 5:00 pm
Cost: $10.00 per person

The family-friendly event will feature a presentation from
Maple Farm Sanctuary co-founder Cheri Ezell-Vandersluis who
will share the compelling story of how she and her husband,
Jim, abruptly ended their profitable generations-long meat and
dairy farming business to create a safe haven for animals. We
encourage event participants to get involved in protecting the
rights of all animals by raising awareness about the cruelty
that exists in the factory farming and fur industries.
Attendees will also be treated to live performances by vegan
musical guests.

Tours of the beautiful Maple Farm Sanctuary grounds will be
available throughout the event. Tour participants will have
the opportunity to learn the animals' stories and meet Cassie
the cow, Piggie Wiggy the potbelly pig, Lucky the pony,
Butterscotch the goat, along with llamas, chickens, horses,
dogs and more.

The Sanctuary has taken in a fraction of the billions of farmed
animals that are bought, sold, tormented and slaughtered by the
meat, dairy and fur industries. They will live the remainder of
their lives in peace, free to roam and meander the land.

There are approximately 80 animals living at Maple Farm
Sanctuary. This includes cows, horses, sheep, llamas, ducks,
chickens, pigs, turkeys, dogs, goats, and a miniature pony.
Maple Farm is located on 121 acres of beautiful farm land in
Mendon, Massachusetts.
See you there!!!
